component.notes:
Obtaining Scene addresses: - Upload your configuration to your host and make sure philips hue is connected as stated above - Copy the Scene states that are listed for this device from "System State" and paste in TextEdit.app (this is because it copies a plist not the actual state) - Now copy the string value and paste that into your data table as required - Re-upload.
To Identify Scenes, the states will be populated with the Scene Code and the Scene name appended. E.G: "Lighting_controller.sceneLights_MEJ8ksJkv9Cp0xE_Relax" The Scene Code for this is "MEJ8ksJkv9Cp0xE" and the name is "Relax" Put the Scene Code into Address1 of your data Table. The sceneLights state show you the Bulb IDs that are included in the scene. E.G: "1, 5, 11, 12, 17". This helps to identify what room the scene is for
RGB Support: To configure RGB sliders, in your data table you must have a seperate entry for R, G and B. Fill out the data table as normal using Address1 as the Light/Group number. Address2 should be filled in as 'r', 'g', or 'b' - LOWER CASE! Currently RGB support is a 'best effort' in terms of slider posistion. All 3 sliders may change when one is updated (due to calculations from RGB to XY and vice versa). Slider may not stay in posistion that it was put in due to the conversions from RGB to XY and vice versa. You will still need a Dimmer entity to control the brightness of the light or group. This makes a total of 4 entries per group/bulb
